note.p: Death: Lewarne, near Liskeard, Cornwall (11 April 1890)

Career: Officer in the Royal Artillery; Lieutenant (1837); made magnetic observations at St Helena and the Cape of Good Hope (1839-1842); was transferred to Toronto, Canada and made expeditions to Athabasca and the Mackenzie River (1844); Captain (1845); Director of the Magnetic Observatory, Toronto (by 1848); returned to London (1853); was sent to Constantinople (1855); Liuetenant Colonel (1855); Inspector General of army schools (1857); Director General of Ordnance (1868); Governor and Commander-in-Chief of the Bermudas (1871-1877); Governor of Tasmania (1880-1882); retired and lived in London, then moved to Cornwall
References: R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 2. After 1847' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 47-84
